repositories.brief_summary: Runtime events system improvements with new word-based counters and bug fixes for variance checking and ocamlprof
repositories.new_features_summary: Enhanced runtime events with word-based allocation counters and fixed variance checking for private types
repositories.new_features:
- **Runtime events system** enhancements with new `EV_C_MINOR_PROMOTED_WORDS` and `EV_C_MINOR_ALLOCATED_WORDS` counters that report values in words instead of bytes for consistency ([#14189](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14189))
- **Documentation improvements** for runtime events counters with clearer unit specifications, marking existing byte-based counters as per-domain and highlighting word-based units throughout the API ([2cbb007](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/2cbb0075e02bc2046b6724366fbd5b54949cd312))
repositories.activity_summary: Merged PRs addressed variance checking bugs, parsing fixes, and ocamlprof instrumentation issues
repositories.activity:
- **Variance checking** fix for private type aliases that were incorrectly allowing stronger variance annotations than their internal definitions by [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) ([#14202](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14202))
- **Parser improvements** for module unpacking constraints by [Thomas Refis](https://github.com/trefis), removing incorrect ghost annotations and cleaning up grammar rules ([#14198](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14198))
- **OCamlprof bug fix** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) preventing instrumentation of unreachable clauses that caused syntax errors ([#14197](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14197), fixes [#14196](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14196))
- **Thread sanitizer test updates** by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) to account for recent runtime changes ([#14203](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14203))
- **Toplevel printing fix** by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) for qualified variant constructors and record labels, restoring proper path hiding ([#14192](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14192), fixes [#14184](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14184))
repositories.discussions_summary: Issues focused on Windows float formatting, domain stack configuration, and compiler stack overflows
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **Windows float formatting inconsistency** reported by [Martin Jambon](https://github.com/mjambon) where `string_of_float` produces zero-padded exponents on Windows but not on Linux/macOS, affecting CI tests ([#14201](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14201))
- **Domain stack size configuration** request by [@dijkstracula](https://github.com/dijkstracula) for making pthread stack sizes configurable to handle deep recursion in C FFI code, with discussion of implementation approaches ([#14195](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14195))
- **Variance checking vulnerability** discussion around [Stephen Dolan](https://github.com/stedolan)'s discovery of how private type aliases could circumvent variance constraints, leading to the implemented fix ([#14200](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14200))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on runtime system observability improvements and addressing cross-platform compatibility issues
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime observability** improvements with enhanced metrics and clearer documentation to support better profiling and debugging tools
- **Cross-platform compatibility** efforts addressing Windows-specific behaviors that cause test failures and development friction
- **Type system robustness** through careful review and fixing of edge cases in variance checking and module system semantics
repositories.issues_summary: Good first issue available for improving compiler error messages with source locations
repositories.good_first_issues: - **Store source locations in structures and signatures** to improve compiler error messages that currently show compiled artifact paths instead of source file paths, making errors more user-friendly ([#12629](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12629))
repositories.contributors_summary: Five contributors provided fixes spanning runtime system, type checker, and development tools
repositories.contributors:
- [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) implemented enhanced runtime events system with word-based counters and comprehensive documentation updates ([#14189](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14189))
- [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) fixed variance checking vulnerability in private type aliases that could bypass safety constraints ([#14202](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14202))
- [Thomas Refis](https://github.com/trefis) corrected parser handling of module unpacking constraints and cleaned up grammar annotations ([#14198](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14198))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) resolved ocamlprof instrumentation bug affecting unreachable pattern clauses ([#14197](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14197))
- [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) updated thread sanitizer tests for compatibility with runtime changes ([#14203](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14203))
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) fixed toplevel path display issues for variant constructors and record labels ([#14192](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14192))

repositories.brief_summary: Performance improvements with C bindings for CPU detection, shared archive caching optimization, and package validation enhancements
repositories.new_features_summary: C binding for CPU core detection replaces system utilities, shared archive caching for packages without checksums, improved error handling
repositories.new_features:
- **CPU core detection** using native C binding instead of system utilities for better portability and performance ([#6634](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6634))
- **Shared archive caching** for packages without checksums to reduce redundant downloads during builds ([#6627](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6627))
- **Enhanced error handling** for non-displayable characters in package names and versions using `Char.escaped` ([#6640](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6640))
- **Formula parsing optimization** in `OpamFormula.atom_of_string` by removing unnecessary exception handling and simplifying version parsing ([491c0b7](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/491c0b715d3ce17a4fcea97c1729d9be650e1207), [06b19b2](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/06b19b217277cac9216b832d18ae24f03fd38861))
repositories.activity_summary: Code cleanup removing duplicated functions, CI improvements with enhanced error handling, and documentation fixes for external links
repositories.activity:
- **API cleanup** by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) replacing polymorphic List.mem usage to avoid `Repr.equal` and removing duplicated functions from OpamStd that already exist in stdlib ([#6644](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6644), [#6442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6442))
- **CI infrastructure enhancements** by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) adding dependency compilation testing and improving shell script safety with `set -ue` flags ([#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6394), [#6648](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6648))
- **Documentation fix** by [Pietro Cerutti](https://github.com/gahr) correcting Software Heritage URL from relative to absolute path ([#6650](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6650))
- **GitHub Actions update** by [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) upgrading checkout action from v4 to v5 for Node.js 24 compatibility ([#6643](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6643))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on performance optimization, build system reliability, and cross-platform compatibility improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Performance-oriented development** with multiple optimizations including C bindings for system calls, caching improvements, and standard library usage over custom implementations
- **Build system reliability** through enhanced CI testing of opam library dependencies and improved shell script safety practices
- **Cross-platform portability** improvements by replacing system-dependent utilities with native code and better error handling for edge cases
repositories.contributors_summary: Five contributors with Kate leading code improvements, R. Boujbel enhancing CI, and others providing targeted fixes and dependency updates
repositories.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) implemented CPU core detection using C bindings ([#6634](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6634)), cleaned up API by removing polymorphic List.mem usage ([#6644](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6644)), removed duplicated functions from OpamStd ([#6442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6442)), and enhanced error handling for non-displayable characters ([#6640](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6640))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) added CI job for testing opam library dependencies compilation ([#6394](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6394)) and improved shell script safety with `set -ue` flags ([#6648](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6648))
- [Pau Ruiz Safont](https://github.com/psafont) implemented shared archive caching for packages without checksums ([#6627](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6627))
- [Pietro Cerutti](https://github.com/gahr) fixed Software Heritage URL from relative to absolute path ([#6650](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6650))
- [Dependabot](https://github.com/dependabot) updated GitHub Actions checkout from v4 to v5 ([#6643](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6643))

repositories.brief_summary: Major boot system refactoring, Melange runtime dependency improvements, and critical bug fixes following 3.20.0 release
repositories.new_features_summary: Copy-on-write file operations, absolute path support in dune exec, and root module optimization improvements
repositories.new_features:
- **Copy-on-write (COW) file operations** for improved performance on filesystems that support it (Btrfs, ZFS, XFS) under Linux ([#12074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12074))
- **Absolute path support** in `dune exec` command, allowing execution of programs using absolute paths within the workspace ([#12094](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12094))
- **Root module optimization** that eliminates false dependencies by skipping unnecessary `ocamldep` execution on root modules ([#12227](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12227))
- **Root module visibility fix** that stops hiding root modules from the include path, improving module accessibility ([#12239](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12239))
- **Melange runtime dependencies enhancement** allowing `melange.runtime_deps` to depend on directory targets for better build flexibility ([#12006](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12006), [#12296](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12296))
- **Custom action dependency system** allowing custom actions to request additional dependencies dynamically ([#12189](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12189))
- **Bootstrap root module support** enabling custom root modules in the bootstrap process ([#12238](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12238))
- **Package management patch fallback** that automatically uses `gpatch` when `patch` command is not available ([#12233](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12233))
repositories.activity_summary: Systematic boot system refactoring with 20+ incremental PRs, post-3.20.0 bug fixes, and performance optimization work
repositories.activity:
- **Massive boot system refactoring** by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) comprising 20+ systematic PRs that modernized module organization, simplified directory scanning, improved type safety, and eliminated manual code generation ([#12293](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12293), [#12295](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12295), [#12294](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12294), [#12291](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12291), [#12292](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12292), [#12290](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12290), [#12289](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12289), [#12286](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12286), [#12288](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12288), [#12287](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12287), [#12285](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12285), [#12284](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12284), [#12283](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12283), [#12282](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12282), [#12281](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12281), [#12280](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12280), [#12279](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12279), [#12277](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12277), [#12278](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12278), [#12274](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12274))
- **Critical post-3.20.0 bug fixes** including runtest path interpretation issues in subdirectories ([#12251](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12251)), runtest alias functionality restoration ([#12242](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12242)), and s-expression formatting regression rollback ([#12245](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12245))
- **Infrastructure improvements** including Docker image publishing during releases by [Sudha Parimala](https://github.com/Sudha247) ([#12252](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12252)), GitHub Actions dependency updates via Dependabot ([#12229](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12229), [#12228](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12228), [#12221](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12221)), and Nix environment improvements ([#12218](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12218))
- **Library refactoring work** by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) representing virtual libraries via improved type systems ([#12276](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12276)), [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) removing unused library parameters ([#12298](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12298)), and fiber system improvements with array-backed variable storage ([#12235](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12235))
- **RPC and formatting enhancements** allowing formatting operations while watch server is running by [Ambre Austen Suhamy](https://github.com/ElectreAAS) ([#12064](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12064)) and dune-lang version usage improvements by [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) ([#11865](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/11865))
- **Documentation and API improvements** including `rev_store` API documentation by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([#12256](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12256)) and `ocamlc -config` parameter exposure by [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) ([#12236](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12236))
repositories.trends_summary: Performance optimization focus, incremental refactoring approach, and immediate post-release quality assurance
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Systematic incremental refactoring** approach demonstrated by the boot system work, where complex changes are broken into 20+ small, focused PRs that can be reviewed and merged quickly while maintaining stability
- **Performance and optimization focus** with multiple initiatives targeting file I/O efficiency (COW operations), build system speed improvements, and elimination of unnecessary computational overhead in dependency resolution
- **Post-release quality assurance** with rapid identification and resolution of regressions introduced in 3.20.0, showing strong community feedback loops and responsive maintenance practices
- **Enhanced developer experience** through improved path handling, better error messages, expanded command capabilities, and more flexible build system configuration options
- **Melange ecosystem integration** with continued improvements to JavaScript compilation toolchain support, indicating sustained investment in multi-target compilation workflows
repositories.issues_summary: OSL preprocessor field implementation available as good first issue for new contributors
repositories.good_first_issues: - **OSL implementation in preprocessor specifications** ([#963](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/963)) - Add support for Ordered Set Language values like `:standard` and `\` in `per_module` preprocessor fields, a feature request from 2018 with positive community support that provides a good entry point for new contributors to learn about dune's configuration system
repositories.contributors_summary: 13 contributors across 60+ merged PRs with systematic refactoring, critical bug fixes, and feature development

- **[Adrian Parvin D. Ouano](https://github.com/adrianparvino)** improved Melange OCaml index integration ([#12246](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12246))

- **[Sacha Ayoun](https://github.com/giltho)** contributed to package management discussions regarding gpatch vs patch handling ([#12232](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12232))

repositories.brief_summary: WebAssembly closure optimization merged with call graph analysis and debugging improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: Closure optimization to omit code pointers when unused, new call graph analysis, and debug timing
repositories.new_features:
- **Closure optimization** for WebAssembly target that omits code pointers when not used, reducing memory allocation and enabling better Binaryen optimizations by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) ([#2059](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2059))
- New **call graph analysis framework** with direct call detection for non-escaping closures, improving function call performance in WebAssembly compilation
- **Debug timing infrastructure** added for Call_graph_analysis and Typing modules to help profile compiler performance
- Enhanced **function call analysis** to detect unambiguous non-escaping closures that can use direct calls instead of indirect calls
repositories.activity_summary: WebAssembly-focused development with ongoing PRs for optimization hints and type improvements
repositories.activity:
- **WebAssembly optimization efforts** continue with multiple draft PRs by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) including more precise Wasm types ([#1907](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1907)) and function type improvements ([#1908](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1908))
- **OCaml compiler integration work** progressing with [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo)'s optimization hints PR ([#1721](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1721)) that consumes hints from ocaml#13438, though benchmarking is blocked by OCaml 5.3 compatibility issues
- **Physical equality hints** development continues in draft PR ([#1745](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1745)) by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo), requiring rebase due to conflicts
- Active **debugging and troubleshooting** of WebAssembly runtime issues with WAMR loader and GC compatibility problems
repositories.discussions_summary: Extensive technical discussion on WAMR/WebAssembly runtime compatibility and debugging approaches
repositories.notable_discussions:
- **WebAssembly runtime compatibility** investigation by [@nickbetteridge](https://github.com/nickbetteridge) experiencing WAMR loader failures with type mismatches and GC object pointer issues ([#1929](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1929))
- **Low-level debugging** of i31 reference handling where OCaml integer values wrapped in GC objects fail to cast properly to i31 types in WAMR runtime
- **Runtime integration questions** about WASI compilation flags and memory export requirements for WebAssembly module compatibility
- **WIT (WebAssembly Interface Types)** future development discussion, with [@nickbetteridge](https://github.com/nickbetteridge) considering either integration into js_of_ocaml or separate library development
repositories.trends_summary: Strong focus on WebAssembly performance optimization and runtime compatibility improvements
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **WebAssembly optimization focus** with multiple concurrent efforts on closure optimization, type precision, and performance improvements ([#2059](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2059), [#1907](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1907), [#1908](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1908))
- **Compiler integration** work to leverage upstream OCaml optimization hints for better code generation ([#1721](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1721))
- **Runtime compatibility** challenges emerging as WebAssembly adoption grows, particularly with different runtime implementations like WAMR ([#1929](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1929))
- **Performance analysis tooling** development with debug timing infrastructure to identify optimization opportunities
repositories.contributors_summary: Primary contributions by Jérôme Vouillon on WebAssembly optimization with community testing and feedback
repositories.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) implemented the closure optimization feature ([#2059](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2059)) and continues developing WebAssembly type improvements ([#1907](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1907), [#1908](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1908))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) provided code review feedback on compilation time performance impacts and maintains optimization hints integration work ([#1721](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1721), [#1745](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1745))
- [@nickbetteridge](https://github.com/nickbetteridge) actively testing WebAssembly runtime compatibility, reporting detailed debugging information on WAMR integration issues ([#1929](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1929))
- [Sora Morimoto](https://github.com/smorimoto), [Ty Overby](https://github.com/TyOverby), and [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) participated in PR discussions with maintenance and technical feedback

repositories.brief_summary: High activity week with compilation optimizations, DWARF debugging improvements, and runtime system enhancements
repositories.new_features_summary: New CFG prologue optimization flags, improved DWARF debugging controls, and Atomic.t API enhancement
repositories.new_features:
- New **CFG prologue optimization flags** for fine-tuning function prologue placement including `-cfg-prologue-validate`, `-cfg-prologue-shrink-wrap`, and `-cfg-prologue-shrink-wrap-threshold` enabling advanced control flow graph optimizations ([#4544](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4544))
- Enhanced **Atomic.t API** by exposing its internal structure as a record with mutable atomic contents field, enabling `%atomic.loc` usage for creating atomic locations to atomic contents ([#4551](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4551))
- **DWARF debugging silencing** mechanism to suppress shape-related errors during compilation while preserving fatal errors for invalid `[@@unboxed]` constructs ([#4556](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4556))
- Fixed **caml_array_blit segfaults** by correcting the noalloc annotation, resolving crashes with `%arrayblit` operations ([#4568](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4568))
- Improved **unboxed product record updates** by eliminating unnecessary `caml_modify` calls for nested structures, optimizing performance for mixed block field updates ([#4553](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4553))
- **Immutable array documentation** update clarifying the need for `stdlib_stable` to access Iarray functions ([#4542](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4542))
repositories.activity_summary: Runtime system improvements and compiler backend enhancements focused on stability and performance
repositories.activity:
- **Runtime domain management** improvements by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) including consistent control flow in `domain_create` ([#4167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4167)), removal of leftover parameters from effect handling ([#4534](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4534)), and preparation for domain GC enrollment fixes
- **Flambda2 bug fixes** including prevention of argument unboxing for indirect unknown arity calls by [@Ekdohibs](https://github.com/Ekdohibs) ([#4554](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4554)) and assertion loosening for match-in-match compilation by [@bclement-ocp](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) ([#4560](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4560))
- **Backend optimizations** including CFG loop computation fixes by [@xclerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#4546](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4546)) and shrink wrapping implementation by [@cfalas](https://github.com/cfalas) for optimal prologue placement ([#4544](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4544))
- **Build system improvements** with removal of nondeterminism in camlprim.c filename by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#4548](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4548)) and version bump to 5.2.0minus-18 ([#4564](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4564))
- **Type system enhancements** including renaming `Targetint_31_63` to `Target_ocaml_int` by [Leo Lee](https://github.com/smjleo) for better accuracy ([#4533](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4533)) and block index operation documentation by [@goldfirere](https://github.com/goldfirere) ([#4541](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4541))
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on compiler stability, performance optimization, and improved developer tooling
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Performance-oriented development** with emphasis on CFG optimization, unboxed type handling, and runtime efficiency improvements across multiple backend systems
- **Enhanced debugging support** through DWARF improvements and better error handling mechanisms, making the compiler more developer-friendly while maintaining robustness
- **API refinement and clarity** with systematic renaming of internal components for better accuracy and comprehensive documentation updates for user-facing features
- **Runtime system hardening** with consistent error handling patterns and improved domain management, focusing on stability for concurrent OCaml applications
repositories.contributors_summary: 17 contributors delivered compiler optimizations, runtime improvements, and documentation enhancements
repositories.contributors:
- [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) focused on **runtime system stability** with domain creation control flow improvements ([#4167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4167)) and cleanup of leftover effect parameters ([#4534](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4534))
- [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) worked on **build system reliability** by removing nondeterminism in camlprim.c filenames ([#4548](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4548)) and implementing shape error silencing for DWARF ([#4556](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4556))
- [Leo Lee](https://github.com/smjleo) contributed **type system accuracy** improvements by renaming `Targetint_31_63` to `Target_ocaml_int` ([#4533](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4533)) and ongoing JSIR backend development
- [@cfalas](https://github.com/cfalas) implemented **CFG prologue shrink wrapping** optimization for better code placement and reduced unnecessary prologue executions ([#4544](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4544))
- [@glittershark](https://github.com/glittershark) enhanced the **Atomic.t API** by exposing its internal record structure to enable advanced atomic operations ([#4551](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4551))
- [@ccasin](https://github.com/ccasin) optimized **unboxed product record updates** by eliminating unnecessary `caml_modify` calls in nested structures ([#4553](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4553))
- [@Ekdohibs](https://github.com/Ekdohibs) fixed **Flambda2 unboxing bugs** preventing incorrect argument unboxing in indirect unknown arity calls ([#4554](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4554))

repositories.brief_summary: Process management enhancements with new API features for Unix process groups, setuid and setgid support
repositories.new_features_summary: Added process group management, setuid and setgid support to Unix process API
repositories.new_features:
- New **process group management** functionality added to Unix backends allowing child processes to be spawned in custom process groups via `setpgid` parameter ([#802](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/802))
- **User and group ID control** for child processes with new `setuid` and `setgid` fork actions, enabling spawning processes as different users ([#803](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/803))
- Enhanced **Unix process API** with optional `?pgid`, `?uid`, and `?gid` parameters in `spawn_unix` function for fine-grained process management ([24c9b82](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/commit/24c9b820121837072728d1afd9e7703b91cbeab0))
repositories.activity_summary: Process management improvements merged, fiber-local state inheritance discussion, Windows path bug report
repositories.activity:
- **Process management enhancements** completed by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) with merging of process groups support ([#802](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/802)) and setuid/setgid fork actions ([#803](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/803))
- Ongoing **API design discussions** around `Buf_write.of_flow` functionality by [Volker Diels-Grabsch](https://github.com/vog) for improving buffered serialization patterns in network protocols ([#796](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/796))
repositories.discussions_summary: Extensive discussion on fiber-local state inheritance across domains with multiple contributors proposing solutions
repositories.notable_discussions:

- **Domain spawning behavior** analysis with multiple contributors including [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) discussing thread safety concerns and potential API modifications for cross-domain context sharing
- **Third-party library integration** challenges highlighted, particularly affecting OpenTelemetry tracing across domains and need for systematic solution
repositories.trends_summary: Focus on process isolation and domain-safe programming patterns with emphasis on security-conscious APIs
repositories.emerging_trends:
- **Enhanced process isolation** capabilities with granular control over process groups, user IDs, and group IDs for security-conscious applications
- **Domain-aware programming patterns** discussion highlighting the complexity of cross-domain state management in effect-based concurrent systems
- **Network protocol library integration** improvements with focus on buffered serialization patterns that work seamlessly with Eio's structured concurrency model
repositories.contributors_summary: Patrick Ferris led process management enhancements, Nathan Taylor initiated fiber-local state discussions, with active maintainer support

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major Dune 3.20.0 coordinated release with infrastructure improvements and Windows ecosystem expansion
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Dune 3.20.0 ecosystem release, TLS/crypto security updates, Windows platform support, and blog aggregation fixes
group_summaries.new_features:

- **Windows platform expansion** with MinGW, MSys2, and Cygwin support for GUI toolkits and audio libraries by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) ([ocaml/opam-repository#28382](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28382), [ocaml/opam-repository#28381](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28381), [ocaml/opam-repository#28378](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/28378))

- **Authentication package modernization** by [Yawar Amin](https://github.com/yawaramin) removing deprecated u2f and enhancing webauthn documentation ([ocaml/ocaml.org#3258](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3258))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Major dune boot system refactoring with 20+ PRs, WebAssembly optimization advances, and post-3.20.0 stability fixes
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Copy-on-write operations, absolute paths in dune exec, WebAssembly closure optimizations, CPU detection improvements
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Copy-on-write (COW) file operations** for improved performance on filesystems that support it (Btrfs, ZFS, XFS) under Linux ([ocaml/dune#12074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12074))
- **Absolute path support** in `dune exec` command, allowing execution of programs using absolute paths within the workspace ([ocaml/dune#12094](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12094))
- **Root module optimization** that eliminates false dependencies by skipping unnecessary `ocamldep` execution on root modules ([ocaml/dune#12227](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12227))
- **Melange runtime dependencies enhancement** allowing `melange.runtime_deps` to depend on directory targets for better build flexibility ([ocaml/dune#12006](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12006), [ocaml/dune#12296](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12296))
- **WebAssembly closure optimization** that omits code pointers when not used, reducing memory allocation and enabling better Binaryen optimizations ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2059](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2059))
- **CPU core detection** using native C binding instead of system utilities for better portability and performance ([ocaml/opam#6634](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6634))
- **Shared archive caching** for packages without checksums to reduce redundant downloads during builds ([ocaml/opam#6627](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6627))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) dominated the week with massive boot system refactoring by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) comprising 20+ systematic PRs, plus critical post-3.20.0 bug fixes and new features including COW file operations and absolute path support ([ocaml/dune#12074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12074), [ocaml/dune#12094](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12094))
- [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) advanced editor integration with multi-type location querying by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) and OpenBSD compatibility fixes ([ocaml/merlin#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951), [ocaml/merlin#1956](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1956))
- [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) focused on performance improvements with [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) implementing CPU core detection via C bindings and shared archive caching ([ocaml/opam#6634](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6634), [ocaml/opam#6627](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6627))
- [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) progressed WebAssembly optimization work with closure optimization merged by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) and ongoing runtime compatibility investigations ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2059](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2059))
- [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) and [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind) saw feature discussions for parameter documentation and duplicate warning improvements ([ocaml/odoc#927](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/927), [ocaml/ocamlfind#111](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/111))
group_summaries.activity_summary: Systematic refactoring approaches, performance optimization focus, and rapid post-release quality assurance across tools
group_summaries.activity:
- **Systematic boot system refactoring** in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [Rudi Grinberg](https://github.com/rgrinberg) with 20+ incremental PRs that modernized module organization, simplified directory scanning, and improved type safety ([ocaml/dune#12293](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12293), [ocaml/dune#12295](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12295), [ocaml/dune#12294](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12294), [ocaml/dune#12291](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12291))
- **Post-release stability fixes** for dune 3.20.0 including runtest path interpretation issues and s-expression formatting regressions ([ocaml/dune#12251](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12251), [ocaml/dune#12245](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12245))
- **Editor integration development** in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) with advanced multi-type location querying functionality and PPX dependency debates ([ocaml/merlin#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951))
- **API cleanup and optimization** in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) removing duplicated functions and replacing polymorphic List.mem usage ([ocaml/opam#6644](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6644), [ocaml/opam#6442](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6442))
- **WebAssembly performance optimization** in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with call graph analysis framework and debugging infrastructure improvements ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2059](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2059))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Dune virtual libraries and ocamlfind integration** issues where [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) reported that dune virtual libraries installing identical cmi files in multiple directories trigger duplicate warnings in [ocaml/ocamlfind](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind) ([ocaml/ocamlfind#111](https://github.com/ocaml/ocamlfind/issues/111))
- **Melange ecosystem improvements** spanning [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) and [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) with [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) enhancing directory target support in dune's Melange runtime dependencies ([ocaml/dune#12006](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12006), [ocaml/dune#12296](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12296))
- **LSP standardization discussions** in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) referencing rust-analyzer approaches for multi-type navigation that could influence [ocaml/ocaml-lsp](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml-lsp) development ([ocaml/merlin#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951))
- **Documentation syntax consistency** efforts in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) exploring parameter documentation that would align with OCaml syntax patterns used across the toolchain ([ocaml/odoc#927](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/927))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **PPX dependency debate** in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) where [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) initially proposed using `ppx_yojson_conv` but maintainers [Xavier Van de Woestyne](https://github.com/xvw) and [Sonja Heinze](https://github.com/pitag-ha) expressed concerns about adding PPX dependencies to merlin-lib ([ocaml/merlin#1951](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1951))
- **WebAssembly runtime compatibility** investigation in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) by [@nickbetteridge](https://github.com/nickbetteridge) experiencing WAMR loader failures with type mismatches and GC object pointer issues ([ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#1929](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1929))
- **Parameter comment attachment** technical discussion in [ocaml/odoc](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc) by [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) and [Thomas Refis](https://github.com/trefis) regarding compiler parser support and consistent syntax with existing attachment rules ([ocaml/odoc#927](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/927))
- **Performance issues** reported in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) by [@v-gb](https://github.com/v-gb) including unpredictable package management rebuilds and slow lock directory parsing ([ocaml/dune#12244](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12244), [ocaml/dune#12248](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12248))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Systematic incremental refactoring** approach demonstrated by [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) boot system work, where complex changes are broken into 20+ small, focused PRs for quick review and merge while maintaining stability
- **Performance and optimization focus** across multiple repositories with file I/O efficiency improvements, WebAssembly optimizations, and elimination of computational overhead ([ocaml/dune#12074](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12074), [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml#2059](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/2059), [ocaml/opam#6634](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6634))
- **Cross-platform compatibility** attention with specific fixes for BSD systems in [ocaml/merlin](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin) and native C bindings replacing system utilities in [ocaml/opam](https://github.com/ocaml/opam) ([ocaml/merlin#1956](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1956), [ocaml/opam#6634](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6634))
- **Enhanced developer experience** through improved path handling, better error messages, and expanded command capabilities across the toolchain ([ocaml/dune#12094](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/issues/12094), [ocaml/opam#6640](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6640))
- **WebAssembly ecosystem maturation** with sustained optimization work in [ocsigen/js_of_ocaml](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml) and Melange integration improvements in [ocaml/dune](https://github.com/ocaml/dune) indicating growing importance of multi-target compilation

group_summaries.brief_summary: High activity week in oxcaml/oxcaml with compiler optimizations and runtime improvements, plus tooling updates in Merlin
group_summaries.new_features_summary: CFG prologue optimizations, enhanced Atomic.t API, DWARF debugging improvements, and better dot-merlin-reader discovery
group_summaries.new_features:
- New **CFG prologue optimization flags** for fine-tuning function prologue placement including `-cfg-prologue-validate`, `-cfg-prologue-shrink-wrap`, and `-cfg-prologue-shrink-wrap-threshold` enabling advanced control flow graph optimizations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4544](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4544))
- Enhanced **Atomic.t API** by exposing its internal structure as a record with mutable atomic contents field, enabling `%atomic.loc` usage for creating atomic locations to atomic contents ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4551](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4551))
- **DWARF debugging silencing** mechanism to suppress shape-related errors during compilation while preserving fatal errors for invalid `[@@unboxed]` constructs ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4556](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4556))
- **Enhanced dot-merlin-reader discovery** with three-tier lookup system: environment variable override (`DOT_MERLIN_READER_EXE`), same directory as Merlin executable, and PATH fallback ([oxcaml/merlin#179](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/179))
- Fixed **caml_array_blit segfaults** by correcting the noalloc annotation, resolving crashes with `%arrayblit` operations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4568](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4568))
- Improved **unboxed product record updates** by eliminating unnecessary `caml_modify` calls for nested structures, optimizing performance for mixed block field updates ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4553](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4553))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **oxcaml/oxcaml** dominated activity with 17 contributors delivering compiler optimizations, runtime improvements, and new CFG features across 21 merged PRs ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4533](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4533) to [oxcaml/oxcaml#4568](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4568))
- **oxcaml/merlin** received focused updates from [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) improving dot-merlin-reader discovery and merging OCaml 5.2.0minus-18 compiler changes ([oxcaml/merlin#179](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/179), [oxcaml/merlin#180](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/180))
- **janestreet/opam-repository** had one bug fix PR from [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) addressing utop conflict clause capitalization ([janestreet/opam-repository#73](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/73))
- **oxcaml/opam-repository** and **oxcaml/js_of_ocaml** showed no activity during this week
group_summaries.activity_summary: Runtime system hardening, Flambda2 bug fixes, and build system improvements across compiler and tooling repositories
group_summaries.activity:
- **Runtime domain management** improvements by [Nick Barnes](https://github.com/NickBarnes) including consistent control flow in `domain_create` ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4167](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4167)) and removal of leftover parameters from effect handling ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4534](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4534))
- **Flambda2 bug fixes** including prevention of argument unboxing for indirect unknown arity calls by [@Ekdohibs](https://github.com/Ekdohibs) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4554](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4554)) and assertion loosening for match-in-match compilation by [@bclement-ocp](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4560](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4560))
- **Backend optimizations** including CFG loop computation fixes by [@xclerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4546](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4546)) and shrink wrapping implementation by [@cfalas](https://github.com/cfalas) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4544](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4544))
- **Build system improvements** with removal of nondeterminism in camlprim.c filename by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4548](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4548)) and version bump to 5.2.0minus-18 ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4564](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4564))
- **Merlin infrastructure improvement** for dot-merlin-reader location resolution with comprehensive test suite covering symlink scenarios and environment overrides ([oxcaml/merlin#179](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/179))
- **Compiler compatibility update** merging OCaml 5.2.0minus-18 changes affecting 70 files with 1008 additions and 611 deletions across Merlin's typing and analysis modules ([oxcaml/merlin#180](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/180))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **OCaml 5.2.0minus-18 version coordination** between oxcaml/oxcaml ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4564](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4564)) and oxcaml/merlin ([oxcaml/merlin#180](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/180)) ensuring synchronized compiler and tooling updates
- **Cross-repository bug tracking** with janestreet/opam-repository PR ([janestreet/opam-repository#73](https://github.com/janestreet/opam-repository/issues/73)) referencing related issue [oxcaml/oxcaml#4437](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4437) for utop conflict resolution
- **Shared contributor activity** with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) working on both compiler changes in oxcaml/oxcaml and corresponding tooling updates in oxcaml/merlin
group_summaries.emerging_trends:

- **Enhanced debugging support** through DWARF improvements and better error handling mechanisms, making the compiler more developer-friendly while maintaining robustness ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4556](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4556))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Runtime events system improvements and OCaml Language Committee governance policy discussions
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Enhanced runtime events with word-based allocation counters and improved documentation
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Runtime events system** enhancements with new `EV_C_MINOR_PROMOTED_WORDS` and `EV_C_MINOR_ALLOCATED_WORDS` counters that report values in words instead of bytes for consistency in [ocaml/ocaml#14189](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14189)
- **Documentation improvements** for runtime events counters with clearer unit specifications, marking existing byte-based counters as per-domain and highlighting word-based units throughout the API in [2cbb007](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/2cbb0075e02bc2046b6724366fbd5b54949cd312)
group_summaries.group_overview:
- **Core compiler development** focused on runtime system observability with new word-based allocation counters and comprehensive documentation updates in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml)
- **Type system robustness** improvements through variance checking fixes for private type aliases in [ocaml/ocaml#14202](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14202)
- **Language governance** discussions in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) centered on conflicts of interest policy for the OCaml Language Committee in [ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55)
- **Cross-platform compatibility** efforts addressing Windows-specific float formatting inconsistencies reported in [ocaml/ocaml#14201](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14201)
group_summaries.activity_summary: Six PRs merged addressing variance checking, parsing, ocamlprof, and testing infrastructure
group_summaries.activity:
- **Variance checking vulnerability** fixed by [Jacques Garrigue](https://github.com/garrigue) for private type aliases that were incorrectly allowing stronger variance annotations than their internal definitions in [ocaml/ocaml#14202](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14202)
- **Parser improvements** by [Thomas Refis](https://github.com/trefis) for module unpacking constraints, removing incorrect ghost annotations and cleaning up grammar rules in [ocaml/ocaml#14198](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14198)
- **OCamlprof bug fix** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) preventing instrumentation of unreachable clauses that caused syntax errors in [ocaml/ocaml#14197](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14197), fixing [ocaml/ocaml#14196](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14196)
- **Thread sanitizer test updates** by [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) to account for recent runtime changes in [ocaml/ocaml#14203](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14203)
- **Toplevel printing fix** by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) for qualified variant constructors and record labels, restoring proper path hiding in [ocaml/ocaml#14192](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14192), fixing [ocaml/ocaml#14184](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14184)
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Language committee governance** discussions in [ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55) involve the same core maintainers ([Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron), [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)) who are actively contributing technical fixes to [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml)
- **Institutional transparency** analysis in the RFCs repository references Jane Street funding relationships that directly impact compiler development work happening in the main OCaml repository
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Windows float formatting inconsistency** reported by [Martin Jambon](https://github.com/mjambon) where `string_of_float` produces zero-padded exponents on Windows but not on Linux/macOS, affecting CI tests in [ocaml/ocaml#14201](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14201)
- **Domain stack size configuration** request by [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) for making pthread stack sizes configurable to handle deep recursion in C FFI code in [ocaml/ocaml#14195](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14195)
- **OCaml Language Committee governance** debate by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) with extensive policy framework discussion including transparency measures and committee member affiliations in [ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55)
- **Institutional bias analysis** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) examining differences between public research institutions and private companies in committee decision-making, with disclosure of Jane Street funding for INRIA compiler development in [ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55)
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime observability focus** with enhanced metrics and clearer documentation to support better profiling and debugging tools, as seen in [ocaml/ocaml#14189](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14189)
- **Cross-platform compatibility efforts** addressing platform-specific behaviors that cause test failures and development friction, particularly Windows issues in [ocaml/ocaml#14201](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14201)
- **Type system robustness** through careful review and fixing of edge cases in variance checking and module system semantics in [ocaml/ocaml#14202](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14202)
- **Governance transparency initiatives** with committee members actively discussing and implementing policies for conflict of interest disclosure and decision-making processes in [ocaml/RFCs#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55)

group_summaries.brief_summary: Process management and directory operations enhanced across eio and ocaml-uring with new Unix API features
group_summaries.new_features_summary: Unix process API enhancements and io_uring directory operations added
group_summaries.new_features:
- **Process group management** functionality added to [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) enabling child processes in custom process groups via `setpgid` parameter ([ocaml-multicore/eio#802](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/802))
- **User and group ID control** for child processes with new `setuid` and `setgid` fork actions in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) ([ocaml-multicore/eio#803](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/803))
- **mkdirat API function** added to [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring) enabling asynchronous directory creation through io_uring ([ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#120](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/issues/120))
group_summaries.group_overview:
- Active development focused on [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) with process management enhancements and [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring) with directory operations
- Six repositories (domainslib, meio, saturn, eio-trace, picos, kcas) showed no activity during this week
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) contributed across both active repositories with Unix API enhancements
group_summaries.activity_summary: Process management improvements merged and fiber-local state discussions in eio, mkdirat implementation in ocaml-uring
group_summaries.activity:
- **Process management enhancements** completed in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) with merged support for process groups ([ocaml-multicore/eio#802](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/802)) and setuid/setgid fork actions ([ocaml-multicore/eio#803](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/803))
- **Directory creation API** development in [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring) with mkdirat function implementation including OCaml interface, C stubs, and test coverage ([ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#120](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/issues/120))
- **API design discussions** in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) around `Buf_write.of_flow` functionality for improved network protocol serialization ([ocaml-multicore/eio#796](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/796))
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) contributed Unix system API enhancements to both [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) and [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring), indicating coordinated development of Unix integration features across the multicore ecosystem
- Process management work in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) complements directory operations in [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring), both enhancing Unix system call coverage for concurrent applications
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Fiber-local state inheritance** discussion in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) initiated by [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) addressing cross-domain context preservation challenges ([ocaml-multicore/eio#807](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/807))
- **Domain spawning behavior** analysis in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) with [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) discussing thread safety concerns for effect-based concurrent systems
- **Third-party library integration** challenges highlighted in [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio), particularly affecting OpenTelemetry tracing across domains ([ocaml-multicore/eio#807](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/807))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Enhanced Unix system call coverage** with focus on security-conscious process isolation through granular control over process groups, user IDs, and group IDs
- **Domain-aware programming patterns** highlighting complexity of cross-domain state management in effect-based concurrent systems and need for systematic solutions
- **Coordinated Unix API development** across [ocaml-multicore/eio](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio) and [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring) improving system-level integration for multicore OCaml applications

weekly_summary.brief_summary: Major OxCaml compiler optimizations with 21 PRs, Dune 3.20.0 stable release, and enhanced multicore Unix API coverage
weekly_summary.new_features_summary: CFG prologue optimizations, Atomic.t API enhancements, DWARF debugging improvements, multicore process management, and Dune 3.20.0 stability

- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **CFG prologue optimization** with new compiler flags `-cfg-prologue-validate`, `-cfg-prologue-shrink-wrap`, and `-cfg-prologue-shrink-wrap-threshold` for advanced control flow graph optimizations [oxcaml/oxcaml#4544](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4544)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Enhanced Atomic.t API** by exposing internal structure as record with mutable atomic contents field, enabling `%atomic.loc` usage for atomic operations [oxcaml/oxcaml#4551](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4551)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **DWARF debugging silencing** mechanism to suppress shape-related errors during compilation while preserving fatal errors for invalid constructs [oxcaml/oxcaml#4556](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4556)

- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Fixed caml_array_blit segfaults** by correcting noalloc annotation, resolving crashes with `%arrayblit` operations [oxcaml/oxcaml#4568](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4568)
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **Process group management** functionality with `setpgid` parameter for child processes in custom process groups [ocaml-multicore/eio#802](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/802)
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **User and group ID control** for child processes with new `setuid` and `setgid` fork actions [ocaml-multicore/eio#803](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/803)
- __RUMINANT:multicore__ **mkdirat API function** enabling asynchronous directory creation through io_uring [ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring#120](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/ocaml-uring/issues/120)

weekly_summary.group_overview:
